p: Before the H1N1 pandemic inÂ 2009 (pdm2009), an avian H5N1 IAV had been remarked as a strong candidate that would cause a next pandemic given accumulating human infection cases with the virus [ 19, 20]. Recently, an avian H7N9 virus has become the focus of attention concerning the increasing number of human infection cases in China [ 21, 22]. However, it is important to remember that pdm2009 was caused unexpectedly by a swine origin IAV [ 16], emphasizing the importance of the surveillance of swine IAVs [ 23]. There are also other subtypes of avian HA and NA isolated from human influenza cases sporadically [ 24, 25]. Given their pandemic potential, we need to assess these human-infecting zoonotic IAVs in detail by comparing with the viruses that had caused past influenza pandemics.
